Navbar

The navbar by default is fixed to the top of the page. The navbar as uses two different colors primary-code and grad-color that can be found in the _base-styles.scss. It can easily be changed throught the grid component.

Container

Containers are the main building block of the layout in Bento. Containers by default center themselves on the page and are set to a max of 960px. This can be easily changed in the base/_base-style.scss and all the components will change to reflect the bigger size. To use a container just add container as a class name.

container

Dark Section

Dark Section's are full width bands that can be used to divide up the page. To use a Dark Section add the .darkSection as a class name. Make sure that the element also does not have .container as well.

Grid

Bento's grid makes use of flexboxes. By default the flex container is set to center items vertically and space-between items. To use the grid give a parent container the class of .grid. Then give the children of the .grid a class name of .one through .twelve .

Grid with the start modifier

Unlike the default grid. By adding the .start to your class name. The grid will not distribute the items evenly. But instead align them to the left

one
two
three
Center modifier

By adding a .center to your grid's class name it will center any grid item inside of the grid. This will override the .start modifier.

eight
Column modifier

You can make items in the grid stack instead of going horizontally by add the .column class name to the grid. This modifier does not override the .start modifier
